What unique capabilities does the Verus testnet offer, and how can I access it?

The Verus testnet, accessible through the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, offers several unique capabilities, including self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identities (VerusID) and staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault). These capabilities are currently not found in other decentralized platforms.

As Verus PBaaS offers completely new capabilities that go beyond today’s decentralized platforms in many fundamental ways, the worldwide Verus community put its energy into creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. Members across the Verus worldwide community have worked hard to make this all possible, and we are more than excited that you can now experience it firsthand. If you have an interest in the future of crypto, you owe it to yourself to learn about Verus, an unlimited scale, decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.### The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.### Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID
- Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. What is VerusID, and what benefits does it offer?

VerusID is a self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identity system that enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses. This means that users have full control over their identities and funds, and can revoke or recover them as needed. VerusID also allows for seamless staking of funds while preventing unauthorized access.

How does Verus Vault prevent theft and enable secure workflows?

Verus Vault is a staking-capable time locking and theft prevention system that allows users to lock their identities, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. Users can specify an unlock delay, which can be long enough to notice any unauthorized attempts to unlock the ID. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID, which adds an extra layer of security. This enables virtually theft-proof workflows and solutions for inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, and identity theft.
